action.action-desc: Mr. Grayson introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Made-in-America Bank Act.

section.header: Redesignation of the Export-Import Bank as the Made-in-America Bank

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of subsection (a) of section 2 of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 (12 U.S.C. 635(a)(1)) is amended by striking Export-Import Bank and inserting Made-in-America Bank.

Any reference in any law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the Federal agency renamed in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Made-in-America Bank.

section.header: Financing made available to American entities purchasing American made goods
section.text: All guarantees, loans, insurance, and any other benefits historically provided by the Export-Import Bank may only be made to a domestic entity that is not majority-owned by any foreign person or entity and only for the purpose of acquiring goods or services made in America.
Section 7 of the Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 (12 U.S.C. 635f) is amended by striking 2014 and inserting 2016.
The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on October 1, 2014, or the date of enactment of this Act, whichever is later.
